intro: Oreastrum, commonly known as the goldenrod, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, golden-yellow flower heads that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in a variety of habitats, including meadows, woodlands, and disturbed soils. Oreastrum species are often found in temperate regions of North America and Eurasia. Its feathery leaves and composite flowers make it a notable presence in natural landscapes.
